label: 吉田兼倶
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: (1453-1511).  [Founder of Yoshida Shinto] who established himself and his descendants as authorities who determined the proper way to perform shrine rituals and granted ranks and certificates to shrine functionaries.  The Yoshida family also granted ranks and titles to shrines.  Between the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries, the Yoshida family succeeded in bringing under their supervision the majority of the country's shrine functionaries (p. 392). [吉田神道]
